headline: Warner Bros. Is Said to Begin Exclusive Talks With Netflix
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. has entered exclusive negotiations to sell its film and TV studios and HBO Max streaming service to Netflix Inc., according to people familiar with the discussions. The two companies could announce a deal as soon as in the coming days, assuming talks don't fall apart, the people said. Bloomberg's Manuel Baigorri breaks down the situation.

headline: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Deal Talks With Netflix
summary: Netflix is offering a $5 billion breakup fee if regulators don’t approve the deal, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the discussions are private.  The move suggests Netflix has pulled ahead of Paramount Skydance Corp. and Comcast Corp., who were also competing for the asset.  Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

Prior to the closing of the sale, Warner Bros. — valued at more than $60 billion overall — will complete the planned spinoff of cable channels including CNN, TBS and TNT.

headline: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  It had been reported that the US streaming giant was in exclusive talks over the deal following a bidding war for the assets.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors.

content.title: Netflix agrees blockbuster $72bn deal for Warner Bros studios
content.summary: Netflix has agreed a $72bn (£54bn) deal to secure Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and supercharge its library through rights to top franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  It had been reported that the US streaming giant was in exclusive talks over the deal following a bidding war for the assets.  Paramount Skydance and Comcast, the ultimate owner of Sky News, were the rival suitors.

headline: Netflix in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery assets, source says
summary:
STORY: Netflix is reportedly in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery's film and television studios, along with its streaming assets.

According to a source with direct knowledge of the matter, it's after offering $28 per share.

The parent of HBO received a second round of bids this week.

Netflix, Paramount Skydance and Comcast had made preliminary buyout proposals.

Reuters previously reported that Netflix was seen as the top bidder, and made a mostly cash offer.

The $28 per share offer compares with Warner Bros' closing price of $24.54 on Thursday (December 4).

And a previous offer from Paramount of nearly $24 for all of the company's assets that also include cable networks like CNN, TNT and TBS.

Netflix and Warner Bros Discovery did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.

Netflix is aggressively diversifying beyond its core subscription model.

A deal with Warner Bros would give it one of Hollywood's most powerful libraries, including "Harry Potter" and "Game of Thrones".

Variety reported the potential deal has led a group of leading film industry figures to urge the U.S. Congress to intervene if Netflix's bid succeeds.

They have apparently warned of a looming economic and institutional crisis in Hollywood.

Paramount has also reportedly accused Warner Bros of running an unfair sale process that favors Netflix over other bidders.

content.title: Netflix in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery assets, source says
content.summary:
STORY: Netflix is reportedly in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery's film and television studios, along with its streaming assets.

According to a source with direct knowledge of the matter, it's after offering $28 per share.

The parent of HBO received a second round of bids this week.

Netflix, Paramount Skydance and Comcast had made preliminary buyout proposals.

Reuters previously reported that Netflix was seen as the top bidder, and made a mostly cash offer.

The $28 per share offer compares with Warner Bros' closing price of $24.54 on Thursday (December 4).

And a previous offer from Paramount of nearly $24 for all of the company's assets that also include cable networks like CNN, TNT and TBS.

Netflix and Warner Bros Discovery did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.

Netflix is aggressively diversifying beyond its core subscription model.

A deal with Warner Bros would give it one of Hollywood's most powerful libraries, including "Harry Potter" and "Game of Thrones".

Variety reported the potential deal has led a group of leading film industry figures to urge the U.S. Congress to intervene if Netflix's bid succeeds.

They have apparently warned of a looming economic and institutional crisis in Hollywood.

Paramount has also reportedly accused Warner Bros of running an unfair sale process that favors Netflix over other bidders.

headline: Instant View: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises, including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry ​Potter", will further tilt the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.

content.title: Instant View: Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit for $72 billion
content.summary: Netflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studios and streaming division for $72 billion, a deal that would hand control of one of Hollywood's most prized and oldest assets to the streaming pioneer.  Buying the owner of marquee franchises, including "Game of Thrones", "DC Comics" and "Harry ​Potter", will further tilt the balance of power in Hollywood in favor of Netflix.

headline: Netflix Lines Up $59 Billion of Debt for Warner Bros. Deal
summary: Wells Fargo & Co., BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Plc are providing the unsecured bridge loan, according to a statement Friday, a type of financing that is typically replaced with more permanent debt such as corporate bonds.  Under the deal announced Friday, Warner Bros. shareholders will receive $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix.

content.title: Netflix Lines Up $59 Billion of Debt for Warner Bros. Deal
content.summary: Wells Fargo & Co., BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Plc are providing the unsecured bridge loan, according to a statement Friday, a type of financing that is typically replaced with more permanent debt such as corporate bonds.  Under the deal announced Friday, Warner Bros. shareholders will receive $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix.

headline: Netflix-Warner Bros deal faces antitrust pushback even as company touts benefits
summary: Netflix pitched its $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery's studios and streaming division as aligned with the priorities of President Donald Trump's competition enforcers on Friday, but intense ​antitrust scrutiny is all but guaranteed.  Netflix executives touted the deal as creating jobs and giving the company's 300 ‌million subscribers "more bang for their buck" by adding more content at a time when the administration is focused on affordability and lower prices for ‌consumers.  But even before it was announced, Netflix's defense of the deal faced criticism from Republicans in Congress, who have warned that Netflix absorbing HBO Max and Warner Bros' content rights would reduce choice for consumers and give the company an unacceptably high share of the streaming market.

content.title: Netflix-Warner Bros deal faces antitrust pushback even as company touts benefits
content.summary: Netflix pitched its $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery's studios and streaming division as aligned with the priorities of President Donald Trump's competition enforcers on Friday, but intense ​antitrust scrutiny is all but guaranteed.  Netflix executives touted the deal as creating jobs and giving the company's 300 ‌million subscribers "more bang for their buck" by adding more content at a time when the administration is focused on affordability and lower prices for ‌consumers.  But even before it was announced, Netflix's defense of the deal faced criticism from Republicans in Congress, who have warned that Netflix absorbing HBO Max and Warner Bros' content rights would reduce choice for consumers and give the company an unacceptably high share of the streaming market.

headline: Netflix’s $59 Billion Loan for Warner Bros. Among Biggest Ever
summary: Wells Fargo & Co., BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Plc are providing the unsecured bridge loan, according to a statement and filing on Friday.  Such loans are a type of financing that is typically replaced with more permanent debt like corporate bonds.  In this case, those bonds are expected to be rated investment grade since Netflix carries an A3 debt grade by Moody’s Ratings and A by S&P Global Ratings.

content.title: Netflix’s $59 Billion Loan for Warner Bros. Among Biggest Ever
content.summary: Wells Fargo & Co., BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Plc are providing the unsecured bridge loan, according to a statement and filing on Friday.  Such loans are a type of financing that is typically replaced with more permanent debt like corporate bonds.  In this case, those bonds are expected to be rated investment grade since Netflix carries an A3 debt grade by Moody’s Ratings and A by S&P Global Ratings.

headline: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Deal Worth $72 Billion
summary: Netflix will buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a deal that reshapes Hollywood and streaming. Warner Bros. shareholders will get $27.75 a share in cash and stock in Netflix. The total equity value of the deal is $72 billion. Geetha Ranganathan of Bloomberg Intelligence has more.

headline: Netflix says its reached deal to buy Warner Bros.
summary: Netflix (NFLX) has won the dramatic bidding war for parts of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) for $27.75 per share. The total enterprise value of the deal is $82.7B. The deal is for Warner Bros. Discovery's film studio and streaming service, HBO Max. The company will still spin out its TV networks, which includes TNT and CNN. Netflix came out on top -- beating out Paramount (PSKY) and Comcast (CMCSA). For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance. Editor's note: The headline on this post has been updated to reflect what Netflix is acquiring.

headline: Key Fed Inflation Rate Makes Rate Cut A Lock; S&P 500 Rallies
summary: The Federal Reserve's primary inflation rate continued to show limited price pressures from tariffs, setting the stage for a third-straight rate cut at next week's policy meeting.  The stale September inflation data, delayed for nearly two months by the government shutdown, won't keep the Fed from cutting to manage the risk of a labor market that appears stagnant and maybe worse.  The overall personal consumption expenditures price index rose 0.3% on the month, putting the 12-month inflation rate at 2.8%.

content.title: Key Fed Inflation Rate Makes Rate Cut A Lock; S&P 500 Rallies
content.summary: The Federal Reserve's primary inflation rate continued to show limited price pressures from tariffs, setting the stage for a third-straight rate cut at next week's policy meeting. The overall personal consumption expenditures price index rose 0.3% on the month, putting the 12-month inflation rate at 2.8%.

headline: Netflix flexes its muscles and could yet get its way in Trump's America
summary: Netflix’s $72bn takeover of Warner Brothers is a blockbuster in every sense.  It is less than 30 years since Reed Hastings and Marc Randolph began their mail order DVD rental business, barely 20 since Netflix began streaming content online, and just over a decade since its first wave of original content, including House of Cards.  Warner Brothers, the studio that made Casablanca, finds itself a subplot in the dramatic transformation of 21st century entertainment, working title: The Triumph of the Streamers.

headline: Movie Theaters Aren’t Thrilled About Netflix Win
summary: Movie theater operators will likely be unhappy with Netflix's $72 billion deal for Warner Bros. Shares of theater exhibitors such as Cinemark and AMC Entertainment, have recently declined on concerns about a Netflix win, Wedbush analysts said in a research note, citing the possibility that Netflix would attempt to significantly shorten the theatrical window or bypass it altogether for most titles.

content.title: Movie Theaters Aren’t Thrilled About Netflix Win
content.summary: Movie theater operators will likely be unhappy with Netflix's $72 billion deal for Warner Bros. Shares of theater exhibitors such as Cinemark and AMC Entertainment, have recently declined on concerns about a Netflix win, Wedbush analysts said in a research note, citing the possibility that Netflix would attempt to significantly shorten the theatrical window or bypass it altogether for most titles.

headline: What to Know About the Netflix-Warner Deal
summary: Netflix is paying $72 billion, or $27.75 for each Warner Bros. Discovery share.  If I own Warner Bros. stock, what happens now?  The deal needs approval from by regulators and target company shareholders, while Warner Bros. also plans to split off its cable division into a publicly traded company.

content.title: What to Know About the Netflix-Warner Deal
content.summary: Netflix is paying $72 billion, or $27.75 for each Warner Bros. Discovery share.  If I own Warner Bros. stock, what happens now?  The deal needs approval from by regulators and target company shareholders, while Warner Bros. also plans to split off its cable division into a publicly traded company.

headline: Wells Fargo Advises on Netflix-Warner Deal in M&A Win for Bank
summary: The San Francisco-based lender is helping provide a $59 billion bridge loan for the deal, along with BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Holdings Plc — though Wells Fargo is the only one among the three banks to snag an all-important advisory credit.  It’s a major win for Wells Fargo, which has set out in recent years to build a muscular investment-banking franchise nearly from scratch to rival top-tier dealmakers including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.  One of the linchpins of that strategy under Fernando Rivas, chief executive officer of corporate and investment banking, has been to use Wells Fargo’s position as one of the largest US business lenders to essentially ask borrowers for a seat at the table when it comes to arranging their mergers and acquisitions.

content.title: Wells Fargo Advises on Netflix-Warner Deal in M&A Win for Bank
content.summary: The San Francisco-based lender is helping provide a $59 billion bridge loan for the deal, along with BNP Paribas SA and HSBC Holdings Plc — though Wells Fargo is the only one among the three banks to snag an all-important advisory credit.  It’s a major win for Wells Fargo, which has set out in recent years to build a muscular investment-banking franchise nearly from scratch to rival top-tier dealmakers including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.  One of the linchpins of that strategy under Fernando Rivas, chief executive officer of corporate and investment banking, has been to use Wells Fargo’s position as one of the largest US business lenders to essentially ask borrowers for a seat at the table when it comes to arranging their mergers and acquisitions.
